description:
Topics in the philosophy of language, especially concerning truth, meaning and
reference. In particular, we will consider questions such as but not limited to whether language is mediated by convention or intention, whether understanding a language is tacitly knowing a theory of that language, whether the meaning of a name is simply its referent, whether mathematical and moral statements are true in virtue of meaning and whether sentences such as ‘breaking promises is wrong’ are statements of moral fact or simply expressions of emotion.
title: Philosophy of Language
